intro: Zeuxine strateumatica var. laxiflora, commonly known as the broad-flowered zeuxine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers with five petals. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets that are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Zeuxine strateumatica var. laxiflora thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
